Rules
(Largely taken from Nobody Special)

General Gameplay

1. You may not directly quote (or pretend to directly quote) the moderator. Paraphrasing (for role claims, etc.) is acceptable.
Bold, purple text
is reserved for the moderator. Small/invisible text is not allowed. Cryptography is not allowed.
2. There is to be NO personal communication outside of this thread unless your role PM specifically allows it.
3. If you have a role with a Night action your choices are due to me by the posted deadline. If I do not receive your choice via PM by the posted deadline you will forfeit your actions.
4. Roles with Night actions will not be able to submit an action on Night 0 (i.e. during the confirmation stage).

Voting, Deadlines, and Death

6. Votes must be submitted formatted as
Vote: snifit
or VOTE: snifit to be counted. Obvious abbreviations and unambiguous spelling errors will be accepted as valid votes.
7. Day phases will last for 3 weeks. If a lynch has not been achieved before the deadline occurs, no one will be lynched.
8. For a lynch to occur, Half+1 (rounded down) of the remaining players must vote for the same player.
9. Instead of a lynch, players may opt to end the Day early via a Vote: No Lynch. Half (rounded down) of the remaining players must vote to No Lynch to end the Day early.
10. A player is considered to be lynched as soon as the required number of votes are achieved. Once a player is lynched, the game is in Twilight until I post a death scene; all players including the one who was lynched may continue to post during Twilight.
11. Night phases will last for 72 hours.

Activity, Etiquette, and Miscellaneous

12. Players who fail to post in a 72-hour period will be prodded via PM. Prodded players have 48 hours from the time of the PM to post in the thread. Players who fail to respond to their prod will be replaced.
13. Upon receiving a third prod, a player will be replaced.
14. Players may declare V/LA if they expect to be unable to post for a period of time. Either PM the moderator or post in bold.
15. Show respect for your fellow players.
16. If you have a request or question for the moderator, either PM it or post it in bold.
17. Violation of these rules will be dealt with according to their severity, up to and including a Modkill.

Sample RoleGreetings! You are a
Vanilla Townie
.

You have no special abilities. Use your voice and your vote as effectively as you can.

You win when all threats to the town have been eliminated and at least one town-aligned player is alive.

Please confirm your role and alignment with me via PM.

The game thread can be found here.

It is now Day 1.

1- what allignment do you prefer playing as, town or scum?

Each has different appeals. As town, the mystery and hunting for clues makes it an awesome experience. As scum, there's the thrill of power and misdirection. If I had to choose one or the other, I'd say town (Considering my experience in mafiascum has been town only and I haven't played here in a while)

2- how many games have you played before this one?

Not exactly sure. In MS, Less than 6. A couple broke due to mod problems.

3- what is your timezone and how many times a day can we expect you to be posting?

GMT - 3. Not sure. At least once a day seems a good default rule but my activity may vary according to the game's pace.

I think we ought to try and maintain everyone's participation roughly similar. If a group of players become excessively active they can not only be unnecessarily focused upon but allow others to simply disappear under the radar. Lurking is bad but spamming is harmful as well.

a. One bullet, one shot based on who are you're going to kill if you had to use it this moment from this list?

Ok. Up to date: I separated questions/answers with each player with area tags so as to be clear. General notes so far at the bottom:

@Pheneas:
@DAMaster I didn't even see the game when it started, as I was busy with exams and all. I really have nothing else to say; your reason for saying you would kill me wasn't personal.

What does seeing when the game started have anything to do with DTMaster asking you about the lack of reaction/acknowledgement of his kill choice?


@URoE:

I went from thinking you were a just-joking-around kind of player (harmful) to what seems like genuine scumhunting yet full of confirmation bias. Some questions from my notes:

urOe voting me is a bit reassuring. At least he stated a reason and moved on, apparently. Still, 2 questions:
1) Did you accomplish what you hoped for by voting yourself?

I also need to more closely check out how a Hider works, I don't think I've ever seen that role before.

DTMaster is at L-2 right now (assuming Uberninja's fos doesn't count as a vote)

Hider is basically pick town at night, everything that happens (most importantly, kills) to them also happens to you. Pick scum at night, you die.

Also, while hiding (so, if you picked SOMEONE), you can not be targeted by any abilities.

Hider wiki page wrote:The Hider has the ability to target one player each night. The Hider is treated like the target for all other roles' purposes - for instance, if the Hider's target gets investigated by a Cop, the Cop will get results on both the target AND the Hider. Alternatively, if the Hider's target gets killed overNight, the Hider will die too.

Most notably, if the Hider tries to hide behind a player who is not Town-aligned, the Hider will passively die and nothing can prevent it. In that way, Hider is similar to a Cop.

While Hiding, the Hider itself is considered an ineligible target for actions - all actions that target the Hider specifically will fail. This applies even to otherwise "piercing" abilities like Strongman kills.

Hider is commonly, but not always, given the X-Shot modifier.

This role is considered Normal on mafiascum.net, but see Variations below.


so they are immune to any action when it hides, if its target dies, it dies too, any other action on the target the hider chooses happens to the hider too, if they visit scum, they die and can't be protected, so if this breadcrumb is true then DTM is scum.

1. First and foremost, Roflcopter is a confirmed town Innocent Child. That leaves me, Elmo, and Arugula. I know I'm town, so in my eyes, that leaves Elmo and Arugula.
2. Arugula was on the SensFan wagon, the IceGuy wagon, the DTMaster wagon, and the Thomith wagon. In other words, ALL of the wagons that made lynches.
3. Elmo Teh AzN was off the SensFan wagon, off the IceGuy wagon, off the DTMaster wagon, and on the Thomith wagon. Only one of the wagons that made lynches.
4. Scum made a point to kill derptown absta101 on Night 2. Why? I have no idea. Maybe it was just a really derpy kill.
5. Scum killed off Humble Poirot last night instead of killing CONFIRMED TOWN ROFLCOPTER. Even more than the N2 absta101 kill, that's either deliberately engineered to rub town's faces in shit, OR it's another derpkill.

Here are
my thoughts
:


1. We saw what looked like a derpkill N2, and what looked like another one on N4. The Junpei N3 one was pretty expected, so that doesn't count. The only other possibility is that scum knew town was hopelessly lost after being all town on SensFan's wagon (this sentence supposes Elmo-scum over Arugula-scum) and decided they could just play with us, like a cat with a mouse, batting it back and forth like a tennis ball, before it eats it. The mouse, not the tennis ball. So I'm confused whether it truly was derpkills, or whether it was just really fucking cheeky scum.

2. Elmo was off both scum lynches, and Arugula was on both. My logic tells me that this means Elmo is scum, but my heart and my gut tells me that this means Arugula is scum. I want to know what roflcopter thinks of this, and I also want Elmo to explain why he was on neither scum wagon, ESPECIALLY after the seemingly incontrovertible evidence provided by Junpei as to why DTMaster was scum, based on Seacore's breadcrumbs.

3. I am considering whether it would be better to no-lynch at this point, or if that would be useless. If it appears I'm going to be the lynch for today, and believe me, I don't blame you guys for wanting it, based on my play thus far (though I would say it's too stupid/scummy to be scum, honestly), then I think a no-lynch is better. Here's why: With the night kill (assuming it's compulsive/compulsory/whatever), that'd leaves 3 alive instead of 4, and that's just a better chance to hit scum by anyone's measure.

Pros: There's a smaller number of townies, and if Roflcopter is not killed, the game becomes broken for town.
Cons: Roflcopter is probably just gonna die, leaving me/us right back here, choosing between Elmo and Arugula.

Weighing that around in my head, I realize that it's probably pretty fuckin' useless to no-lynch. Whereas if roflcopter was not confirmed town I would 100% be insistent upon no-lynching at this point.

4. So that means the best course of action is for me to convince roflcopter somehow that I'm not the remaining scum, and just lynch to kill the final scum. Which I'm fine with. At the start of this day, I had no idea who to suspect. Roflcopter was among my list of suspects, along with even a few dead people (yes, I really hadn't been paying attention). After that, I began to suspect Arugula a lot, mostly because of the posts made at the end of Day 4, and because it seemed like Elmo wasn't town because of posts I'd read from the scum. HiderGreetings! You are a Town Hider.

At Night, you may target one player to Hide with:
* Any actions targeting that player will resolve on you in addition to that player--for example, if your target is Killed, you will die as well.
* If your target is not town-aligned, you will die.
* Any abilities that target you while you are Hiding will not resolve.

You win when all threats to the town have been eliminated and at least one town-aligned player is alive.

Please confirm your role and alignment with me via PM.

* Track: You will follow your target, learning who (if anyone) they targeted that night.
* Shoot: You will kill your target.
* Block: You will prevent your target from performing any actions.
Once you have used an ability, you may not use it again.

You win when all threats to the town have been eliminated and at least one town-aligned player is alive.
